channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Can Europe’s New Military Spending Help Its Economies?
item.description: The continent’s leaders hope a surge of investment, to fill a security void left by the United States, can ignite growth. It won’t be easy.

item.title: Europe targets Apple and Google in antitrust crackdown, risking fresh Trump tariff clash
item.description: Google is likely to have broken new competition rules, while Apple is the first Big Tech firm to be ordered to comply in specific ways.

item.title: Autocrats and state-run media are celebrating Trump’s silencing of Voice of America, saying the storied news outlet was ‘discarded by its own government like a dirty rag’
item.description: "This is a major contribution to eliminating fake news," said Cambodia's former Prime Minister Hun Sen, who ruled his country for nearly four decades.

item.title: Jack Schlossberg Slams JFK Files Release and the Media’s Coverage
item.description: In a series of social media posts, Jack Schlossberg, a frequent critic of the Trump administration, said his family was not given a “heads up” about t...

item.title: Trump Has Hinted at a Xi Visit. China Is Still Wondering What He Wants.
item.description: Chinese experts say Beijing is open to talks but is being stonewalled by the State Department and other official channels.

item.title: Israelis Take to Streets a Day After Gaza Strikes
item.description: Israeli protests are converging over the war in Gaza and domestic politics amid concerns about a government push to reduce the power of state watchdog...

item.title: The Judiciary’s Role
item.description: We cover President Trump and his latest adversary: the courts.

item.title: Trump Spoke With Zelensky About Next Steps After Putin Call, White House Says
item.description: The Ukrainian president had appeared open to Russia’s offer of a partial cease-fire but deeply skeptical after President Trump spoke with President Vl...

item.title: Turkey Arrests Istanbul Mayor, Key Rival to President Erdogan
item.description: The mayor, Ekrem Imamoglu, was detained after prosecutors accused him of corruption and terrorism. The opposition said the arrest was politically moti...

item.title: Trump’s tariffs and policies are putting America’s economy at risk: Consumer Technology Association CEO
item.description: Higher tariffs are already creating “cost shocks” for businesses, which for many will be passed on to consumers.

item.title: Israelis Take to Streets a Day After Gaza Strikes
item.description: Israeli protests are converging over the war in Gaza and domestic politics amid concerns about a government push to reduce the power of state watchdog...

item.title: The Boeing Starliner astronauts have returned to Earth after nine long months stuck in space—but their $150,000 salary won’t come with overtime
item.description: In comparison, bankers in New York make an average of $111,000 annually, without the risk of being exposed to an indefinite stay in dark, noiseless, i...

item.title: Florida Mayor Drops Threat to Evict Cinema Over Showing of ‘No Other Land’
item.description: After an emotional city meeting, the mayor of Miami Beach dropped his effort to end a theater’s lease over its showing of “No Other Land.”

item.title: Israeli Forces Expand ‘Targeted Ground Activities’ in Gaza Strip
item.description: The military said it had seized part of a major corridor that separates the enclave’s northern half from the south.

item.title: Bitcoin is at its lowest price since November. Here’s what analysts say about buying the dip
item.description: The original cryptocurrency is down 30% from January highs because of Trump’s tariffs and inflation fears.
